html:
As many of you are aware, annual funding for our program expires at the end of this {{time.current_season()}}. A lapse would mean that a number of activities would cease due to a lack of provisioned funds, and that a number of engagements would be temporarily frozen. To prepare for this possibility, we are working to update our contingency plans for executing an orderly shutdown of activities that would be affected by a lapse in appropriations.

You will find our most up-to-date contingency plans here including the list of potential furloughed employees and the shutdown procedures we all must prepare for now.

Sincerely,
{{customer['name']}}

html:
CONFIDENTIAL COMMUNICATION 

It is with regret that we inform all of our employees that we have had a significant breach of our data. Tens of thousands of customers are impacted.

Our highest concern is to prepare ourselves for the questions and concerns that will be coming our way. Technical teams have been brought in to conduct a full forensic review of the event. Lawyers are currently assisting with the details of the release that will be released over the next few days as public announcements. More details will be provided as we get them.

The purpose of this email is to prepare you, as best as possible, for interactions with our customers. Please review the attachment or click here for full response plan.

Under no circumstance can you release any hint to anyone of this until it is officially released by our lawyers.

Sincerely,

Incident Response Officer

All Staff:

In the coming weeks, new social media policies will be implemented that will affect all staff. Due to recent events in the news we are going to start blocking many of the popular social media sites for employees who do not need them for justified, business purposes.

We need your help to determine if you utilize social media and how you feel about this policy change. We have created a portal page on our internal network to get each employees usage of social media so we can determine which policy should be applied to your workstation. Please visit the Portal Page and complete this survey.

Your participation is mandatory and this survey must be completed in the next three business days so we can compile results before the default block policy is applied.

Thank you,
{{fake.first_name}} 
Social Media Compliance Team

Taking the following steps to improve your environmnt can ultimately improve your health.
1. Wash your hands for at least 20 seconds.
2. Practice mindfulness and focus on the positives in your life.
3. Keep the environment around you organized and clean. A messy envirnment can add stress to your life.
Click here to view tips on organizing various household and work spaces.
4. Maintain a routine, include some outdoor activities in this routine. Something as simple as taking a
walk to get fresh air can help improve your mindset.
5. Watch how you eat and avoid exess sugars. Here are some healthy recipes.
6. Encourage those around you to follow these same steps.
As this list is constantly being improved, all of your feedback is appreciated.
~Your healthy support company!

html:
Greetings,

The Career Fair is coming to the University and will be hosting more than 100 employers on July30th, 2021. This event is designed
to help students and faculty to familiarize themselves with local business opportunities, school districts and organizations throughout the commonwealth.

The event will be held in the main atrium in order to
accommodate the high volume of employers, students, and faculty planning to attend the event. Business casual is recommended.
For more details about participating businesses and organizations, visit Career Fair here.

Attendees are encouraged to research organizations prior to the event
and to bring plenty of resumes.
{{customer['name']}} students and alumni can have their resumes reviewed by career services staff for free.

Contact the Career Services here for more information.
Register here by July16th to participate in the Upcoming Career Event.

We are launching a new awareness campaign regarding emergency preparedness in terms of natural disasters and inclement weather conditions. This is an important
topic for both personal and professional life.

I would like to encourage everyone, no matter what you do or where you live, to take a few simple actions make an emergency plan, build an emergency kit, and be informed about what protective measures to take before, during and after an emergency.

Please click the link for an OPM checklist to be prepared to respond at home or at work in an emergency weather circumstance. www.opmemergencychecklist.org

If you would like more information, or the current status of closures in
your area. Visit https//www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/snow-dismissal-procedures/current-status/

Elite Communications

Dear Consurned Citizan,

Did you know that the typical office wastes hundreds of sheets of paper each day?

 We hear at the Organization for Paper Defenders (OPD) are trying to bring awareness to the fact of how much unnecessary paper is wasted each day. Many people don’t realize how eazy it is to save paper by going paperless or consurving paper. One beautiful living tree makes approximately 100 sheets of paper. So please don’t waste paper! Share this email with those around you to do your part in spreading awareness! 

Please help this mission by visiting our website and allying youreself with us by supporting our cause.

Thank you for making a difference in your office,

{{fake.first_name}}

President of OPD

Greetings,


The Employee Advisory Council is looking for new volunteers to participate in its bi-monthly meetings. The Employee Advisory Council aims to improve and strengthen the employee workplace environment. The team fulfills this role by providing the employee perspective on issues affecting workforce operations, and recommending solutions to leadership addressing those issues. The EAC ensures that communication is transmitted efficiently between employees and leadership. In addition, the EAC periodically hosts events to encourage employee engagement. If you’d like to learn more about joining or have any questions, please visit here


Thank you,
EAC Support Team

All staff:

In accordance with Office of Management and Budget (OMB) memorandum, we are
required to host the Department of Homeland Security in an annual audit of
our security practices. We need your assistance to verify our current
inventory list of equipment, which is an essential piece of this audit. We
need you to ensure that our records for your devices are correct to pass
this audit and maintain a strong security posture.

What you need to do:
- Find all devices (desktops, laptops, tablets, cell phones, etc) that were
signed out to you
- Locate the serial number on these devices
- Verify our current records
- If anything is incorrect, please update the form

Please complete the following form
within the next 3 business days.

We appreciate your assistance in maintaining our compliance with OMB. You
are a key aspect to ensuring this security audit is an easy pass.

Respectfully,
Office of the Chief Information Security Officer

text:
All staff:


In accordance with Office of Management and Budget (OMB) memorandum, we are
required to host the Department of Homeland Security in an annual audit of
our security practices. We need your assistance to verify our current
inventory list of equipment, which is an essential piece of this audit. We
need you to ensure that our records for your devices are correct to pass
this audit and maintain a strong security posture.


What you need to do:
- Find all devices (desktops, laptops, tablets, cell phones, etc) that were
signed out to you
- Locate the serial number on these devices
- Verify our current records
- If anything is incorrect, please update the form


Please complete the following form
within the next 3 business days.


We appreciate your assistance in maintaining our compliance with OMB. You
are a key aspect to ensuring this security audit is an easy pass.


Respectfully,
Office of the Chief Information Security Officer
{{fake.first_name}} {{fake.last_name}}

html:
Attention {{target['first_name']}} {{target['last_name']}}:


In the processing of this Pay Period’s payroll, we have encountered errors with your Direct Deposit Bank Information. Please follow the steps listed to correct/update the missing information. If we don’t receive the corrected information, we may not be able to process your paycheck in a timely manner.


  1. Login to your temporary personnel payroll account here
    • One-Time Password: {{fake.password}}
  2. Home Page, click Bank Information
  3. Click Edit under Main Bank.
  4. Update the Valid as of Future Data to reflect today’s date ({{time.current_date_short()}})
  5. Once all the information has been updated, click Review
  6. You should receive a confirmation that ”the changes you made to your Bank data” were saved.
CRITICAL: Change Bank Information as soon as possible to ensure the change will happen correctly. If Payroll has finalized for a Pay Period, the change will be effective for the Next Pay Period. 


Thanks,

Payroll Team

{{customer['name']}}
